column5: The title pretty much explains it, I need fly jigs in 1/100oz (in bulk preferably) for a decent price. The only place around here I know sells them is BPS but I don't like to buy anything there and it's too expensive anyways. I'm also looking for 5/32" gold brass tying beads in bulk packs.  Thanks, Chris
I forgot to mention, they have to be within the GTA or nearby with fast and inexpensive shipping (someone like Luremaking.com).

There's a good source on eBay from Pennsylvania that sells 50 packs  The precision moulds are really expensive in this size so ultra small jigs will cost more. I was buying some 1/50 ounce from eBay with no problems and delivery in about 10 days. $7 USD plus about the same in shipping
Thanks, I get a little concerned ordering from the states. I need these things within about 3 days at most, anyone have an idea of what size brass bead equals 1/100oz?
Give this site a try:  http://www.uniproducts.com/eng/dealers.asp  Simply choose Country and Province and a list of suppliers appears.  Regards, Snowball
Canadainiiama.com When I ordered my beads they sent me small sample of Llama fur. Really nice.
did u try Tom at Ang Spec?
Just saw some neat stuff on centerpinangling under steelhead flies/jigs

I've used Canadian Llama as well before for beads and the service is great but not sure they'll be with you by the weekend - http://www.canadianllama.com/  FWIW a 4mm sphere of brass is 1/100oz so to take into account the hole, you probably need 5mm or so which is 3/16"
Thanks for the help guys, I ended up settling and am going with the standard jig head/bead/pin method.

I kinda prefer the bed/pin method anyways, litlte more room on the shank to tie  not sure about local, but cabelas has micro jigs that I use for perch and trout jigs  tiemco makes great hooks too, i have some 45 degree jig hooks in size 14 but I would guess they make 90 degree too
